docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate will hunker down at 2 p.m. today to reshape legislation designed to overhaul the financial regulatory system, a process that could take at least two weeks.
docs.abstract: Much attention will be devoted this week to the Senate's debate over the financial regulatory bill.
docs.snippet: Much attention will be devoted this week to the Senate's debate over the financial regulatory bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: G.O.P. Candidates for Governor Debate | With a little more than five weeks before the June primary, two Republicans vying to lead California debated on Sunday night. Meg Whitman, the former chief executive of eBay who is considered the front-runner in the race, and Steve Poizner, the state insurance commissioner, each sought to portray themselves as the more conservative of the two. Both candidates called for the repeal of the new federal health care law and the suspension of the state's landmark global warming law. Ms. Whitman is now almost even in polls with Jerry Brown, the Democrats' major candidate, who also is the state's former governor. Mr. Poizner, who wore a blazer with no tie, tried to paint Ms. Whitman, a billionaire who has poured her own money into the race, as out of touch with ordinary people. Mr. Poizner, a former Silicon Valley entrepreneur, has also spent much of his own money on his campaign. [The New York Times]

headline.main: Sampler: Republican Candidates Debate, and Silicon Valley Rents Creep Up

docs.abstract: A selection of stories of interest to residents of the Bay Area.
docs.snippet: A selection of stories of interest to residents of the Bay Area.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note to readers: My five posts this week chronicle the events of the week of Feb. 15. I'm publishing them with some misgivings, as one might get the impression that my business is days from failure at all times. Fortunately, this is not so. That week was especially dramatic because of the timing of the payments in and out. Also, it marked the beginning of an uptick in sales. From where I sit today, the recovery has begun. We now have a normal backlog of work and sufficient cash on hand to complete it.

headline.main: My Week in Cash Flow: Monday

docs.abstract: On a recent Monday morning, a small-business owner arrived at work and found he had payments totaling $22,666.31 that had to go out the door. His bank balance: $355. Here's how he gets through the week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Complexity used to be so simple. It meant progress. We liked it. Now the most intractable issues of our age, from war to finance, are tangled in ways that inspire headaches, not awe.

headline.main: It’s Complicated: Making Sense of Complexity
